CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 27, 1953, pg. 4, reads: "Camera Shy - Miss Ruth Agee of West Newton tries to hide behind her large pocketbook as she waits in Alderman Harris B. Fitzgerald's courtroom in Pittsburgh to withdraw charged of non-support of her four-year-old daughter, brought several months ago, against John B. (Dizzy) Gillespie, nationally known band leader and idol of the 'beebop set.' Gillespie was arrested on Wednesday, June 17, after he finished playing a one-night engagement at the Walter Robinson American Legion Post in Sewickley.  Mother, the daughter, Cheryl, and Gillespie, all chatted amicably as the case was being withdrawn and everyone seemed pleased over the settlement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Ruth Agee holding purse to face in courtroom of Alderman Harry Fitzgerald to hear non-support case against Dizzy Gillespie
